urls.title: The changing reality of working in a virtual environment and why dynamic risk assessment is key | Safety and health at work EU-OSHA
urls.description: Two new discussion papers examine virtual working environments and dynamic risk assessment. One focuses on how the virtual working environment and occupational safety and health are being impacted by the digital transformation. The other looks at how dynamic risk assessment, a term used to signify the digitisation and innovation of risk assessment, deals with digital data and fast-changing risks. What are the opportunities and challenges? How are policy, research, and practice being impacted? What are the benefits and drawbacks?

urls.title: Circular economy and OSH: new policy briefs on digitalisation and waste management | Safety and health at work EU-OSHA
urls.description: EU-OSHA has published two policy briefs focusing on the role of digitalisation and waste management in the circular economy and its implications for occupational safety and health (OSH). Under EU-OSHA‚Äôs foresight study on the circular economy four future scenarios were developed to anticipate changes and identify OSH risks. The potential pathways could vary widely and are designed to encourage dialogue and reflection with stakeholders around future possibilities so that today‚Äôs decision-making can render policy more future-oriented.
